title: 10% of McDonald's orders come via online food delivery platform Uber Eats
text:
McDonald's has revealed that one in ten orders now comes through online food delivery platform Uber Eats.

The service, which allows customers to have their food brought to their front door, was first tested in the summer of 2017.

Now, out of 1,250 McDonald's stores in the UK, 950 offer a delivery service. On one day alone – September 18 – there were more than 124,000 orders placed for delivery with McDonald's.

McDelivery: Food delivery platform Uber Eats allows customers to have McDonalds food brought to their front door

The service has become so popular that the restaurant has received complaints about long queues of helmet-clad delivery drivers at the front counter.

The company's UK boss, Paul Pomroy, said: 'Convenience has been, and is, key to driving our growth – being where our customers want, when they want.'

The company also announced it is testing small, takeaway-only stores in cities.

As McDonald's released a quarterly update, the UK arm said it will have opened 40 new outlets by the end of this year, although it declined to comment on closures.

The global business reported sales of £4.2billion in the three months to September, a 1 per cent increase compared with last year.

Profits in the quarter fell 2 per cent to £1.2billion.
